Articles.Content:
Graphics settings: MAX
Resolution: 1080p

Interestingly, I'm the only one who notices how the launch pad looks terrible from a distance, it feels like there is no smoothing at all. And it's not just for launch pad, looks like I'm playing on ps3.


P.S. I hope this is done temporarily for optimization, otherwise..

Edited June 10, 2023 by markyy
You're not the only one. Most people noticed it back in February though.
This is a known and uncommented problem of the game. It is even surprising how such a result was achieved in the unity engine.

It was discussed, even before release, so no you're not the only one.

If I remember correctly, there are some problems with the settings so I don't think it's a thing that is going to stay in the long run.

From my understanding the introduction of HDRP will probably help with this because it has some AA settings. So I will wait until then to complain about AA.

Edited June 10, 2023 by Spicat

I don't get why this kind of thing remain uncommented... I've submitted a question for the AMA regarding it, i'm quite sure I was not the only one, and there is a lot of mention of it in Threads, reviews, etc. So instead of very conventional (yet totally okay don't get me wrong) question picked, almost Always not very technical, I don't get why it's not commented...

1 hour ago, Dakitess said:

I don't get why this kind of thing remain uncommented... I've submitted a question for the AMA regarding it, i'm quite sure I was not the only one, and there is a lot of mention of it in Threads, reviews, etc. So instead of very conventional (yet totally okay don't get me wrong) question picked, almost Always not very technical, I don't get why it's not commented...

 

Probably Mortoc is too busy to come back and post about it?  His posts were very informative but I imagine he has better things to do.
Sure but it's more than a technical aspect, it's something mandatory for a game, like, really, and it's quite concerning that we don't have an information in the Official posts or in AMA.

19 minutes ago, Dakitess said:

Sure but it's more than a technical aspect, it's something mandatory for a game, like, really, and it's quite concerning that we don't have an information in the Official posts or in AMA.

It’s just that KSP2 has so many large-scale problems that the developers don’t get their hands on graphics. Even the hangar is more boring than it was in KSP1, because life was in full swing there! What is well done in the game? Only tutorials and trailers...
This probably counts for the interstellar update because it will simulate the entire journey but I guess that will not work in this state of the game.
